page.title: 01Barle Valley South Exmoor
page.content: The river Barle runs thorugh a 'combe' or valley,containing ancint oak and beech woodlands,with modern confer plantations. There is wildlife aplenty,red deer,trout and buzzard. Higher up on mnaged moorlnd areas, stone walled farms are the only evidence of the continuing struggle by hardy families to mae use of the meagre natural moorland resources of heather,bracken and grass. In summer the tough Exmoor horn sheep and Red cattle roam freely over common nd. In winter, prudent farmers bring their animals down to sheltered fields and barns. The famous exmoor ponies however remain free throughout the year. Many footpaths,with 'dykes' (stone walls with beech hedges) attract tourists in summer, while in winter local farmers and country people hunt fox and deer to keep
